page.title: 20Henry Tudor lands again
page.content: This year there was a re-enactment of the landing of Henry Tudor who landed near Dale 500 years ago in preparation for his defeat of Richard III.All Dale school children went to Mill Bay on the coast about 2 miles away to see his landing.They followed him to Dale meadow where there was a Medieval Fayre held on August 7 with archery and a show of cannons firing.There was a demonstration showing how 2 knights could be overcome by a man-at-arms. There was a hoop-la stall,ducking stool,drinking a yard of ale,pillory, pig roast.The girls and women wore long dresses down to their feet.They had pointed head-dresses.The boys and men wore tights and waistcoats.Many people also wore sackcloth tunics. Thousands of people came to this unusual celebration.
